report_title: Private Boat Charters in the US
executive_summary: The COVID-19 pandemic worked in favor of some private boat charter services like luxury yacht rentals and sailing that allowed small groups to participate in outdoor activities while adhering to restrictions. Following slowdowns in 2020, pent-up demand exploded and as trips and consumer spending returned, private boat charters benefitted. Revenue is expected to grow at 2.4% annualized to $876.4 million through 2024, with profit reaching 16.7%.

current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The pandemic nudged consumers towards boat charters as an escape from social distancing, with a 13-year high in boat and marine product sales of $47 billion in 2020 reported by the National Marine Manufacturers Association. While personal/small charters were popular, large party/motor boats were not, limiting revenue growth.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Digital Shift in the Boat Rental and Charter Industry
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Online marketplaces are altering the boat rental/charter industry dynamics, making it more accessible and lowering entry barriers, attracting new operators. The rise in nonemployer operators indicates a trend of independent owners listing boats for rental/charter.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Pent-Up Demand Lifted the Industry in 2021
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Following a 2020 downturn, pent-up demand would push the industry past pre-pandemic levels in 2022 as vaccines allowed safer travel and opened floodgates for domestic/international trips, benefitting cruise lines.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: The Digital Wave in the Boat Charter Marketplace
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The surge in digital rental/charter platforms is easing industry entrance and enabling consumer-to-consumer transactions. The proliferation of rental options is set to diversify the targeted consumer demographic, improving the total addressable market.

Continued easing of travel restrictions and middle-class consumers starting to vacation again is anticipated to boost the market. US consumers are expected to spend more over the next 5 years, strengthening demand for charters. The aging population will also strengthen revenue.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Stabilizing Environment to Help Secure Revenue Growth
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The industry faced a delayed pandemic recovery, but a stabilizing environment will help private boat charters better secure revenue growth as the previous period's volatility tapers off.

industry_definition: Operators in this industry charter private boats for individuals and groups.

negative_impact_factors: Barriers To Entry Level - low - steady

opportunities: High Performance Drivers - Households earning more than $100,000
threats: Time spent on leisure and sports

key_trends: More people are turning to the internet for their daily needs and this has led to a significant shift in focus for businesses. In response to this trend, companies are now making efforts to ensure their online presence is effective.
An aging population and an expected jump in consumer spending is set to bolster industry demand. However, this growth could be superficial if they demand goes elsewhere.

The federal government maintains exclusive jurisdiction over the navigable water of the United States, including the nation's deep draft channels and harbors. This authority is primarily delegated to the US Coast Guard and the US Army Corps of Engineers.

Operators must also comply with the minimum level of federal safety and personnel licensing laws and regulations. Any infringement or endangerment will result in a per-day fine, which could total up to $42,750.

Boat charter services offer a range of vessels to suit any group of people, whether clients are seeking luxury travel and parties to more technical sailing options. The COVID-19 pandemic in 2020 impacted some services more than others, with party boats taking the biggest hit.

market_segmentation.segment_description: Individuals aged 35 and under make up the second highest percentage of downstream demand. The nature of several product segments strengthens this relationship.
This segment benefits from higher disposable income levels, which propels this age bracket to hold the highest demand out of all of them.
Despite having the most free time, lower disposable income limits this segments overall demand.

products_and_services.product_description: Motor boats include the rental services of small, medium and large vessels that are propelled by motors attached to the boat, as opposed to a sail.

Party boats are slow, lumbering vessels, outfitted to safely fit the most amount of people on board. Catamarans are large stable boats containing both sails and motors on board, giving the best of both worlds.

This product consists of sailboat rentals including both self-guided and captained. With the captained charter being a much higher price point. Packages for this service can also include drink and meal options for more money.
Hosting parties and luxury travel are the two main reasons why consumers rent this service. This product line rents yachts, offering the pinnacle of comfort and style.

tier_2_suppliers: Boat Dealership and Repair in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_title: SAILING REMAINS A SMALL, BUT STEADY SERVICE
demand_determinants.determinant_description: While this service is much less popular than motor or party charters, the technical nature provides customers with a learning experience on top of the experience, with many boat packages offering sailing lessons.

business_locations.location_description: The Great Lakes region has 16.7% of establishments and 14.9% of the population.
The Mid-Atlantic region has 14.3% of establishments and 13.4% of the population.
The New England region has 4.8% of establishments and 4.5% of the population.
The Plains region has 8.3% of establishments and 6.8% of the population.
The Rocky Mountains region has 6.0% of establishments and 7.0% of the population.
The Southeast region has 23.8% of establishments and 21.8% of the population.
The Southwest region has 14.3% of establishments and 19.5% of the population.

basis_points.basis_title: Competition is high in this industry because the barriers to entry are so low
basis_points.basis_description: Anyone who owns a boat and a license can participate. Concentration is low, also as a result of low barriers to entry, with most operators renting out single or small fleets of boat charters.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Ability to vary services to suit different needs
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Industry clients frequently have custom demands and desires when chartering boats. As a result, industry operators need to be flexible to accommodate their clients' desires.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Providing services to groups with high disposable income
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Industry operators typically provide services to high earners and wealthy clients. As a result, they must be able to attract business from such customers.
When chartered boats have crews, clients frequently take the crew's reputation into account when considering different charter options.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: In 2021, depreciation costs are expected to account for 10.3% of industry revenue, representing a significant expense. Due to the cost of yachts and other types of boats that the industry charters, capital expenditures for the industry are high, and therefore, depreciation, which represents a smoothed measure of capital expenditures, is also high.

volatility_points.volatility_title: The COVID-19 pandemic brought ruin to the industry
volatility_points.volatility_description: Revenue has historically been fairly stable for private boat charters. While significant events, like the 2007-2008 financial crisis, can bring volatility, the industry typically enjoys stability. This context left the industry wholly
Since consumer income levels are highly reactive to macroeconomic changes. So when inflation blew up across the US economy in early 2022, demand for private boat charters swayed.

technological_change_points.technological_change_description: The industry is experiencing a low level of both the rate of new patents and the concentration of patents in the industry. This creates an environment where the threat of new technologies driving disruption is low.

FAQs.question: How have you been able to increase the number of services you offer? How have you been able to be flexible to suit different needs?
FAQs.answer: Industry clients frequently have custom demands and desires when chartering boats. As a result, industry operators need to be flexible to accommodate their clients' desires.

FAQs.question: How are you able to attract groups with high disposable income? How do you cater to this group specifically?
FAQs.answer: Industry operators typically provide services to high earners and wealthy clients. As a result, they must be able to attract business from such customers.

FAQs.question: What kind of reputation do you require for personnel? Have you had difficulty in the past acquiring quality personnel?
FAQs.answer: When chartered boats have crews, clients frequently take the crew's reputation into account when considering different charter options.

FAQs.question: Are you able to change your offerings and prices according to the economy? How does the decreasing leisure time affect your business?
FAQs.answer: Time spent on leisure and sports includes the time consumers spend on many activities, including travel and surfing the internet. As this category includes time spent on industry services, it is positively correlated with industry revenue.

FAQs.question: Has your company experienced demand disruption from domestic travel restrictions amid the coronavirus pandemic? How have you adapted your business model?
FAQs.answer: An increase in expenditure on recreational activities may include consumers purchasing more boat charter services. As a result, when such expenditures rise, industry revenue tends to increase.

FAQs.question: How many of your customers have a high level of income? How can you cater to low-income markets?
FAQs.answer: Households earning more than $100,000 account for most industry revenue as boat charters are targeted toward high earners and wealthy individuals. As a result, when the number of households earning more than $100,000 increases, industry revenue also tends to rise.
